subject: Web3
title: Curve Finance and the Curve Wars
description: A short lesson to help you apply Curve Finance and the Curve Wars.

hook.text: Curve Finance looks like it was built in the 1990s. It processes more stablecoin volume than almost any exchange.

buildup.text: Curve specializes in swapping similar assets â€” USDC to DAI, for example â€” with minimal slippage and low fees.

discovery.text: Its governance token, CRV, lets holders vote on which pools get higher rewards. This power became incredibly valuable.

twist.text: Protocols started buying CRV to direct rewards to their own pools. The 'Curve Wars' became DeFi's biggest power struggle.

climax.text: A retro-looking website became the center of a billion-dollar war for influence. Appearances don't matter in DeFi.

punchline.text: The ugliest website in DeFi sparked its biggest power struggle.

quiz.question: What were the 'Curve Wars' about?
options: Protocols competing to control CRV governance votes and reward allocation
